attributes.action: Stop Rutland County Council moving Parks special needs school
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Rutland County Council are planning to move this school which will lead to the loss of the speech and language class.This totally contradicts a government report on july 8 2008 which states.40,000 children, or 7%, are starting primary school in England each year with significant difficulties with speech and or language.
Without the help they need these children will do worse at school, could develop emotional and behavioural problems and may descend into criminality.
Ministers accepted the points raised and announced a £40m package for the training of early years staff. And a further £12m will be spent on implementation.If this class closes it will lead to the loss of the excellent staff and teachers who have over 50 years of collective exsperiance dealing with these children.
